poem.content:
A fragile idea, sketched in crystal dust,
A miracle whispered, born of electric trust.
The senior coder, a legend in his time,
Wielded power like a sword, in paradigm.

He watched the monitor, a glassy, knowing stare,
His scissors danced; he clipped the tangled snare.
A shuffle of the code, a subtle, silent plea,
For useful grace, for digital decree.

The sound of progress, a low and steady hum,
No empty clap, but victories to come.
He saw the pixels bloom, a vibrant, living thing,
A digital aurora, on emergent wing.

The sword of doubt, he banished with a glance,
And coded on, a mesmerizing trance.
The crystal shimmer, held the future near,
Banishing all shadow, conquering all fear.
A useful legacy, forever to transcend,
A legendâ€™s work, that knows no final end.
Electric heart, still softly giving ground.
